intro: Guettardella benguetensis, commonly known as the Benguet starleaf, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, star-shaped leaves and clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in montane forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
